intro: Polygala recta, commonly known as the straight-stemmed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white and are arranged in clusters, making it visually distinct. Polygala recta is often found in open vegetation types such as grasslands and shrublands.
